oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christopher Ammons resting during a patrol
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons is resting among concealing foliage while on patrol. He has a towel around his neck (a common practice for soldiers on patrol) and his M16 lies across his lap. Large leaves and tall grass can be seen behind him.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Soldiers; Uniforms; Military uniforms; Hats; Arms & armament; Helmets
United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Patrols were the most common assignment for the soldiers of the security detachment on Vung Chua. Patrols were sent out to check for Viet Cong activity and to set flares, mines, and seismic detectors.
